title: Atomic Layer Deposition (ALD) Process
description: A schema representing the steps and parameters involved in setting up and verifying an Atomic Layer Deposition process for various materials, including platinum, hafnium, zirconium oxides, titanium nitride, and tin oxide.

reactantSelection.description: Selection of precursor and co-reactant based on their reactivity, volatility, and safety.

precursor.description: Chemicals used as precursors in the ALD process, e.g., TiCl4, (methylcyclopentadienyl)trimethylplatinum (MeCpPtMe3).

coReactant.description: Chemical used as a co-reactant in the ALD process, e.g., water (H2O), ammonia (NH3).

deliveryMethod.description: Method of delivering the precursor to the reaction chamber, e.g., evaporated from an open boat.

processParameters.description: Parameters that define the conditions and settings of the ALD process.

ALDMethod.description: The specific ALD technique used, e.g., thermal ALD, plasma-enhanced ALD.

materialDeposited.description: The material being deposited, e.g., Titanium Dioxide (TiO2), Platinum, Hafnium Oxide.

depositionTemperature.description: The temperature range at which deposition is performed, significantly affects growth rates and film properties.

pressure.description: Pressure conditions within the reactor during deposition, e.g., 250 Pa.

reactor.description: Type of reactor used for the ALD process, e.g., flow-type F-120 ALD reactor.

crystallinity.description: Describes whether the film is amorphous or crystalline, e.g., polycrystalline, and details of crystalline phases such as monoclinic, tetragonal, orthorhombic.

pulseTimes.description: Pulse times for precursor and co-reactant, influenced by temperature.

precursorPulseTime.description: Time in seconds for pulsing the precursor, e.g., varies based on deposition conditions and temperature.

coReactantPulseTime.description: Time in seconds for pulsing the co-reactant, e.g., varies for NH3.

purgeTimes.description: Time in seconds for purging the reactor chamber between pulses, e.g., varies based on adsorption properties.

growthRate.description: Growth rate of the film in nm per cycle, varies with temperature and precursor, e.g., 0.04 to 0.07 nm per cycle for TiO2 at 150 to 400°C.

substrate.description: Details about the substrate used in the deposition process.

type.description: Type of substrate used, e.g., borosilicate glass, ITO, Si(100).

temperatureImpact.description: Impact of substrate temperature on film properties.

thicknessControl.description: Control and verification of material thickness per cycle including dosing and purge times.

growthPerCycle.description: The amount of material deposited per cycle, typically measured in Å per cycle, e.g., varies for titanium nitride, 0.70 Å/cycle at 150°C for tin oxide.

dosingTime.description: Time for dosing the precursor or co-reactant, measured in seconds.

purgeTime.description: Time for purging the reactor chamber, measured in seconds.

filmDensity.description: Density of the film, typically measured in g/cm3, e.g., 21.5 g/cm3 for bulk platinum, 5.85 g/cm3 for zirconium oxide, 9.23 g/cm3 for hafnium oxide, varies for titanium nitride.

refractiveIndex.description: Refractive index of the film, range 2.08 to 2.15.

resistivity.description: Electrical resistivity of the film, e.g., 12 µΩ-cm for a 110-nm film, varies for titanium nitride.

breakdownResistance.description: Breakdown resistance of the film in MV cm-1.

uniformity.description: Assessment of film thickness uniformity across large substrate areas.

variation.description: Permissible variation in film thickness, typically measured in percentage.

conformality.description: Ability of the film to coat 3D structures uniformly.

aspectRatio.description: Aspect ratio of the 3D structures used in testing conformality.

impurities.description: Levels of impurities in the film.

carbon.description: Carbon content in the film, measured in atomic percentage, varies for titanium nitride due to potential incorporation of dimethylamino species.

nitrogen.description: Nitrogen content in the film, measured in atomic percentage.

hydrogen.description: Hydrogen content in the film, measured in atomic percentage.

safetyAndEnvironmental.description: Safety and environmental considerations in the ALD process.

safety.description: Safety considerations for handling chemicals and reaction products.

filmStability.description: Whether the film remains stable under intended environmental conditions.

reproducibility.description: Consistency of film thickness and properties in repeated experiments.
